The dish is a classic for this Irish holiday, which will be marked with a new public holiday on 6 February. St. Brigid is one of Ireland's three patron saints, and is most associated with the miraculous abundance of food. ‚Å£
‚Å£
P√°draic √ìg Gallagher is the owner of Gallagher's Boxty House located in Temple Bar, Dublin, serving their specialty Boxty Pancakes since 1988. This recipe is crisp on the outside ‚Äì comforting on the inside.‚Å£

Boxty Pancakes‚Å£
By P√°draic √ìg Gallagher‚Å£
‚Å£
Ingredients‚Å£
‚Å£
ü•î 150g peeled raw potato‚Å£
ü•î 50g cooked mashed potato‚Å£
ü•î 120g plain flour‚Å£
ü•î 220ml whole milk‚Å£
ü•î 2g salt‚Å£
ü•î 10g butter‚Å£
‚Å£
Instructions‚Å£
‚Å£
ü•£ Put flour, mashed potato, salt and 175ml of the milk in a blender and combine.‚Å£
ü•£ Grate raw potato into a clean cloth, squeezing excess water from the potatoes.‚Å£
ü•£ Add grated potatoes to the mash mix and incorporate with a hand whisk (not the blender). It should have a nice dropping consistency like a good batter. Add more milk if necessary.‚Å£
ü•£ Leave for 30 minutes.‚Å£
ü•£ Heat a pancake pan to a medium heat, add butter, allow to melt.‚Å£

Is sahlab the perfect Christmas drink?

The hot, holiday drink is a thick and rich mix of milk, sugar and spices, much like a latte. For Palestinian American cookbook author Blanche Shaheen, sahlab is a story of family and culture that hails from the streets of Bethlehem.

Shaheen includes this sahlab recipe in her cookbook Feast in the Middle East. She also demonstrates the recipe on her YouTube channel.

Sahlab
By Blanche Shaheen

Ingredients:
‚òïÔ∏è 3 tbsp (26g) corn starch (cornflower)
‚òïÔ∏è 4 cups (950ml) milk (either regular or dairy-free milk of your choice)
‚òïÔ∏è ‚Öì cup (65g) sugar
‚òïÔ∏è 1 tsp (5ml) rose water or orange blossom water
‚òïÔ∏è ‚Öì cup (25g) coconut
‚òïÔ∏è ‚Öì cup (40g) finely chopped pistachios
‚òïÔ∏è Cinnamon, to taste

Instructions:
1. Stir corn starch into ¬Ω cup (120ml) of the milk until dissolved, set aside.
2. Bring the remaining milk and sugar to a boil in a saucepan, then lower to a simmer and stir to make sure the sugar dissolves.
3. Add the corn starch (cornflower) mixture to the milk in the saucepan.
4. Simmer for 10 minutes over low heat, stirring constantly to keep lumps from forming.
5. Add the rose water or orange blossom water, stir again, and serve in individual small cups.
6. Sprinkle each cup of milk with one rounded teaspoon each of pistachios and coconut.
7. Dust with cinnamon and serve immediately

Isfenƒü: the Andalusian Doughnut Recipe
By H√©l√®ne Jawhara Pi√±er

Makes: 8

Time: 20 min + 4 hours (or overnight) + 20 min

Ingredients:

1 tbsp fresh yeast + ‚Öì cup (70ml) lukewarm water
3 cups (450g) flour
2 tsp sugar
¬Ω tbsp salt
1‚Öî cup (330ml) lukewarm water
neutral oil for frying

Instructions:

In a small bowl, dilute the fresh yeast with lukewarm water.
In a large bowl, or in the bowl of a food processor, add the dissolved yeast, flour, sugar and salt. Mix and gradually add the water. The dough should be sticky.
Knead for 15 minutes and cover the bowl. Rest overnight (or for at least 4 hours).
Then, heat the oil in a frying pan or in a deep fryer over medium-high heat.
Lightly dip your hands into some water and take a portion of the dough (the size of a golf ball).
Make a hole in the middle of the dough and stretch it well. Then, fry the dough for 30 seconds to one minute, turning it over once.
These are usually eaten on their own, but you can sprinkle them with sugar and lightly dip them in honey if you want them to be sweet.

Chef Leandro Carreira's Salada de Bacalhau Cru (Raw Salt Cod Salad) ‚Å£
‚Å£
Prep time: 25 minutes‚Å£
Cooking time: 20 minutes‚Å£
Serves 4‚Å£
‚Å£
Ingredients:‚Å£
450g salted cod, de-salted and rehydrated (by soaking the salted cod in water for up to 2 days, and changing it each day until the desired salt point is achieved)‚Å£
2 red bell peppers‚Å£
2 eggs‚Å£
100ml olive oil‚Å£
30ml white wine vinegar‚Å£
1 small onion, peeled and diced‚Å£
2 garlic cloves, peeled and diced‚Å£
1/3 bunch flat-leaf parsley, very finely chopped‚Å£
Sea salt and freshly ground pepper to taste ‚Å£
‚Å£
Instructions:‚Å£
Check that the cod is not too salty before cooking. If it is, then leave to soak for another 2 hours. Drain.‚Å£
Prepare a barbecue or preheat an indoor grill or broiler.‚Å£
As soon as the barbecue coals are glowing, put the red bell peppers onto the grill rack and roast for 8 minutes, or until blackened all over. Put inside a plastic bag or cover with food wrap and leave to rest. Alternatively, cook under the broiler.‚Å£
Once the peppers are cool enough to handle, remove the skin and seeds, slice the flesh into thin strips and set aside.‚Å£
Once the cod has the desired saltiness, remove the skin and bones, then shred the flesh. Set aside.‚Å£
Have a bowl of iced water nearby. Bring a saucepan of water to the boil. Once boiling, add the eggs and cook for 6 minutes, then transfer them to the bowl of iced water and leave to cool.‚Å£
Remove the shells and cut the eggs into slices.‚Å£
Combine all the ingredients, except the parsley, in a serving bowl and toss everything together.‚Å£
Taste and adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper, if necessary, then add the parsley before serving.‚Å£
‚Å£
